Violation_Type: Immigration violation - refusal of refugee status based on credibility and procedural fairness
Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of RPD's decision in denying refugee status
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) sections 96 and 97
Application_Facts: Ms. El Aoudie claimed sur place refugee status after converting to Christianity in Canada; feared persecution in Morocco due to religious conversion
Decision_Outcome: RPD denied refugee status, citing doubts about authenticity of conversion and potential immigration motive
Court_Ruling: Federal Court found RPD decision unreasonable due to failure to consider all evidence
Claimant_Status: Applicant for refugee status under Convention refugee or person in need of protection
Defendant_Behavior: RPD panel dismissed claim primarily based on perceived lack of religious knowledge and suspicion of immigration motivation
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution based on religion (conversion to Christianity) in Morocco
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of religious conversion, genuineness of belief, risk of persecution upon return
Applicable_Legislation: IRPA sections 96, 97, and subsection 72(1) for judicial review
Procedural_Issue: Failure by RPD to properly assess all relevant evidence
Credibility_Assessment: RPD questioned authenticity of conversion due to limited religious knowledge and timing of conversion
Evidence_Used: Baptismal certificate, psychological reports, testimony of applicant
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 96 (Convention refugee), s. 97 (person in need of protection), s. 72(1) (judicial review)
Application_Basis: Sur place refugee claim based on change in circumstances (religious conversion) after arrival in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Insufficient consideration of documentary and expert evidence supporting conversion
Relief_Sought: Allowance of judicial review and remittal of case for redetermination
Governing_Rule: A refugee must face persecution for a Convention ground; decision must be based on a fair and complete assessment of evidence
Evidentiary_Deficiency: RPD failed to address key pieces of evidence, including baptismal proof and mental health impact
Outcome: Judicial review allowed; decision set aside and referred back to a new RPD panel for redetermination
Decisional_Body: Immigration and Refugee Board – Refugee Protection Division (IRB-RPD)
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in Morocco due to apostasy from Islam and conversion to Christianity
Cause_Description: Ms. El Aoudie sought refugee protection in Canada after converting to Christianity, fearing persecution if returned to Morocco
Evidence_Handling: RPD did not adequately weigh or explain dismissal of supporting evidence
Legal_Provision_Violated: Procedural fairness under IRPA and principles of reasonableness in administrative decision-making
Evidence_Issues: Disregard of corroborative documentation and expert psychological evidence
Residency_Compliance: Applicant was present in Canada legally at time of claim
Misrepresentation_Element: Alleged by RPD: suggestion that conversion was fabricated for immigration purposes
Jurisdictional_Issue: None – RPD had jurisdiction over refugee claim
Evidence_Assessment: Incomplete and unreasonable evaluation of evidence related to religious conversion
Decision_Rationale: RPD doubted sincerity of conversion without sufficiently justifying rejection of objective evidence
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to engage with baptismal certificate and psychological reports
